page.title: 07THE VILLAGE OF SUTTON CHENEY
page.content:
The village itself covers an area of approx. 0.15 sq.km. and is surrounded by land devoted to agricultural usage. The majority of the 150 or so residents are not however reliant upon farming for their income and generally commute daily to their place of employment.
The village has no shops but does possess a Post Office, a coffee house and two public houses, the Greyhound Inn and the Hercules Inn. Bed and breakfast facilities are also available for tourists to the area.
Sutton Cheney is serviced each week by a mobile greengrocer, and fishmonger and also the mobile library. The only bus service available is to Nuneaton and runs on Thursday and Saturday of each week.
